snippet: A federal judge largely upheld a jury’s verdict that found the Middle Eastern bank liable for 24 terrorist attacks.
abstract: Federal Judge Brian M Cogan upholds verdict finding Arab Bank liable for supporting 24 terrorist attacks after allowing money linked to Hamas to be sent through its banks; grants bank's motion to remove two attacks from case, due to insufficient evidence; denies bank's motions for new trial and expedited appeal.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge largely upheld a jury’s verdict that found the Middle Eastern bank liable for 24 terrorist attacks.

headline.main: Judge Drops 2 Terror Attacks From Arab Bank Case
headline.print_headline: Judge Removes Two Attacks From Arab Bank Terror Case
